---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/URLComponents
crawled: 2025-12-03T07:35:22Z
---

# URLComponents

**Structure**

A structure that parses URLs into and constructs URLs from their constituent parts.

## Declaration

```swift
struct URLComponents
```

## Overview

This structure parses and constructs URLs according to [http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt]. Its behavior differs subtly from that of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URL] structure, which conforms to older RFCs. However, you can easily obtain a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URL] value based on the contents of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/URLComponents] value or vice versa.

## Creating URL components

- **init()**: Creates a URL components instance without defining any of the components.
- **init(string:)**: Creates a URL components instance from a URL string.
- **init(string:encodingInvalidCharacters:)**: Creates a URL components instance from the provided string, optionally IDNA- and percent-encoding any invalid characters.
- **init(url:resolvingAgainstBaseURL:)**: Creates a URL components instance from a URL string, optionally resolving against a base URL.

## Getting the URL

- **url**: A URL created from the components.
- **url(relativeTo:)**: Returns a URL based on the component settings and relative to a given base URL.
- **string**: A URL derived from the components object, in string form.

## Accessing components in native format

- **fragment**: The fragment subcomponent.
- **host**: The host subcomponent.
- **encodedHost**: The host subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **password**: The password subcomponent of the URL.
- **path**: The path subcomponent.
- **port**: The port subcomponent.
- **query**: The query subcomponent.
- **queryItems**: An array of query items for the URL in the order in which they appear in the original query string.
- **scheme**: The scheme subcomponent of the URL.
- **user**: The user subcomponent of the URL.

## Accessing components in URL-encoded format

- **percentEncodedFragment**: The fragment subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **percentEncodedHost**: The host subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **percentEncodedPassword**: The password subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **percentEncodedPath**: The path subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **percentEncodedQuery**: The query subcomponent, percent-encoded.
- **percentEncodedQueryItems**: The query subcomponent, as an array of percent-encoded query items.
- **URLQueryItem**: A single name-value pair from the query portion of a URL.
- **percentEncodedUser**: The user subcomponent, percent-encoded.

## Locating components in the URL string representation

- **rangeOfFragment**: Returns the character range of the fragment in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfHost**: Returns the character range of the host in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfPassword**: Returns the character range of the password in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfPath**: Returns the character range of the path in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfPort**: Returns the character range of the port in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfQuery**: Returns the character range of the query in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfScheme**: Returns the character range of the scheme in the string returned by the string property.
- **rangeOfUser**: Returns the character range of the user in the string returned by the string property.

## Using reference types

- **NSURLComponents**: An object that parses URLs into and constructs URLs from their constituent parts.

## URLs

- **URL**: A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
- **URLQueryItem**: A single name-value pair from the query portion of a URL.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- ReferenceConvertible
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
